suppress.notes: file name example: spring-security-core-4.2.7.RELEASE.jar, spring-security-cweb-4.2.7.RELEASE.jar reason: (CVE-2018-1258) only valid if specifically using in combination with Spring 5.0.5 RELEASE. https://pivotal.io/security/cve-2018-1258 (CVE-2020-4508) false positive for spring security 5.6.x, see https://github.com/OSSIndex/vulns/issues/276
file name: spring-core-5.3.20.jar reason: resolved CVE - only valid if using HTTPInvokerServiceExporter
( file name: spring-web-5.3.20.jar reason: resolved CVE - only valid if using HTTPInvokerServiceExporter
file name: tds-5.0.0-SNAPSHOT.war: chronicle-wire-2.17.5.jar reason: not a chronicle-wire vulnerability (wire package for Android and iOS)
file name: edal-coveragejson-1.4.2.1-SNAPSHOT.jar reason: not an edal-java vulnerability (CVE is for a node-based CLI tool)
file name: jettison-1.4.1.jar reason: not a jettison vulnerability (CVE is for a node-based CLI tool)

file name example: taglibs-standard-impl-1.2.5.jar reason: These CVEs are for a GO based project called tag (MP3/MP4/OGG/FLAC metadata parsing library). False positive. See https://github.com/dhowden/tag/issues/77 (from first CVE listed)
file name: jdom2-2.0.6.jar reason: mitigated by https://github.com/Unidata/thredds/pull/1368
file name: velocity-1.7.jar reason: used by edal-java, but that application, as well as the TDS, does not allow users to upload/modify velocity templates, so not impacted by this.
file name: h2-1.3.173.jar reason: flagged by owasp as being vulnerable, but we are not using this dependency in the tds, so a false positive.
file name: commons-io-1.3.2.jar reason: We do not use the vulnerable function (FileNameUtils.normalize)
file name: guava-31.1-jre.jar reason: NetCDF-Java does not use the vulnerable function (com.google.common.io.Files.createTempDir())
file name: json-20230227.jar reason: We do not use the vulnerable function (XML.toJSONObject)
file name: screenshot_sync reason: False positive. We do not use the fredsmith utils.

file name: javax.el-3.0.0.jar reason: This jar contains an older, insecure version of junit. NetCDF-Java uses junit-4.13.1 for applications running JDK 1.7 and later. We require Java 1.8 at a minimum, so we're good with regards to this CVE. See https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-15250.
